column3: Komuxio is pining for a wayward friend.
Komuxio fears for the safety of his friend Claxio, who has wandered off unaccompanied. He bids you find Claxio and bring him back to Little Solace.
Though you are able to find Claxio, the sylph has no intention of returning with you. Take word of this to Komuxio, who awaits at Little Solace.
According to Komuxio, malign sylphs are prowling the area, and Claxio is in grave danger. You must track him down before he falls thrall to primal influence.

You find Claxio just in time to prevent malign sylphs from spiriting him away. Though he appears unharmed, he may yet have been corrupted by the influence of the primal. Speak with the wayward sylph and ascertain his condition.

After an emotional exchange with Komuxio, Claxio agrees to return to Little Solace. The threat posed by the malign sylphs remains, however. Concerned for the safety of both his kin and the people of Gridania, Komuxio bids you deliver a message to Catguistl at the Adders' Nest.
Catguistl is deeply troubled by the news that beguiled sylphs have set their sights upon the residents of Little Solace, and promises to tighten security around the settlement.
Speak with Catguistl at the Adders' Nest.
Helpful one arrives at a good time! This one needs helpful one's help!
One of these ones named Claxio ventured outside Little Solace alone. Alone is unsafe! Helpful one must find Claxio!
Claxio struck west after leaving the settlement. Hurry before Claxio ends up in the belly of a beastly one!
What? Walking one wants this one to return to Little Solace? Don't make this one laugh!
This one is weary of living with those who are not these ones. This one wants to be alone.
These ones rely on walking ones for everything. No better than those ones that summoned a primal one! Small wonder this one chose to leave!

This one thought this a likely place to build a home. But then meddling one arrives─forces this one to go deeper into the forest. Meddling one is forbidden from following this one! Away with meddling one!
What? Claxio refused to return to these ones, and went deeper into the forest!?
B-But this one saw dark ones lurking in the forest─lurking in the forest not long ago!
Dark ones are here to catch these ones─make these ones thralls to primal one! Helpful one must hurry─hurry and find Claxio!
Claxio is absent of mind─is like to drop possessions like thread. These things will lead helpful one to Claxio.
Helpful one should search for pieces of thread on the forest floor. Those things will lead helpful one to Claxio. But hurry! Hurry, before dark ones take Claxio away!
Claxio! This one has been worried! So very worried! Is Claxio unharmed? Still in possession of wits?
K-Komuxio? And meddling one as well... Why are these two here?
These two came to rescue Claxio! That Claxio is safe fills this one with joy!
But...this one abandoned Little Solace. Does Komuxio not hate this one?
Claxio is this one's friend. A friend is not to be hated. Even helpful one was worried about Claxio, see?
K-Komuxio... Please forgive this one. This one was afraid.
These ones who live at Little Solace were changing─becoming friendly with other ones.
This one feared that these ones were forgetting who these ones are...like dark ones did. But this one was wrong. This one can see that now.
Meddling─er, <Emphasis>helpful</Emphasis> one. This one is grateful. This one will gladly return to Little Solace.
This one has another favor to ask of helpful one. Claxio is safe, but more and more dark ones are coming. The danger has not passed.
These ones will watch out for dark ones. Walking ones should watch out for dark ones as well.
Helpful one must deliver a warning to the Adders' Nest. A walking one there called Catguistl is a friend of this one. Catguistl will heed this one's words.

Ah, you're the one whom they call sylph-friend, are you not? Word of your exploits at Nine Ivies has reached all our ears.
Hm? A warning from Komuxio, you say?
Tempered sylphs running rampant near Little Solace!? This is troubling news indeed...
Very well, I shall recommend that security be tightened in the area. My thanks for bringing word, friend.
